intro: Pleroma glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered pleroma, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pleroma glomeratum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
